description: From Old French lineal, from Latin līneālis, from līnea (“a line”) +‎ -ālis (adjective-forming suffix). By surface analysis, line +‎ -al. Doublet of linear.

entries.meaning: Having an ancestral relationship to mothers, fathers, grandparents, (etc.) and having a descendant relationship to sons, daughters, grandchildren (etc.), exclusive of collateral siblings.
Inheriting by direct descent; having the right by direct descent to succeed (to).
In the direction of a line; of a line; of or relating to a line; measured on, or ascertained by, a line; linear.
